itemDescription: British children's fiction and Quaker writer (pseudonym)

wikipedia_page.main: Elfrida Vipont Brown (3 July 1902 – 14 March 1992) was an English children's author born in Manchester into a family of Quakers. As a children's author, she initially published under a man's name, Charles Vipont, which was a common marketing device by publishers at the time. She later wrote as Elfrida Vipont, and after her marriage sometimes as E. V. Foulds. She was also a schoolteacher and a prominent Quaker herself.

response: *Elfrida Vipont (1902–1992) – The Lark in the Morn, The Lark on the Wing, The Elephant and the Bad Baby
*Elfrida Vipont – The Lark in the Moon
*Carnegie Medal for children's literature: Elfrida Vipont, The Lark on the Wing
*Elfrida Vipont with Raymond Briggs – The Elephant and the Bad Baby
* Rather odd people, by Elfrida Vipont Foulds
* So Numerous a Family: 200 Years of Quaker Education at Ackworth, 1779-1979, with Elfrida Vipont Foulds (1979).
*Elfrida Vipont was the pen name of Elfrida Vipont Foulds (née Brown) (1902–1992)
* Elfrida Vipont, pen name of Elfrida Vipont Foulds (1902–1992), British author of children's books
